Articles.Content:
The Atlas-Centaur rockets flew from 1962 to 2004, flying 197 times, and launching many prolific missions, including Pioneer 10&11, Mariner 9&10, The Surveyor Landers, SOHO, among others. 

Press 1 to disable the side Booster engines. 

[Download](http://kerbalx.com/SaturnianBlue/Atlas-Centaur.craft)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T18:15:16Z" title="06/16/2015 06:15  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by SaturnianBlue**
If you can fix the things we need to worry about, I would bet a rep ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

This is marvelous! Repped ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Never seen a replica that has the "2.5" staging ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Is there a way to update craft files on KerbalX? I fixed the problems regarding the rocket.

You bet! I re-uploaded the craft:)

Turning the Booster rockets 90 degrees from East was enough to keep tail connectors safe, and I edited the bottom a little to help with stability.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-16T18:21:36Z" title="06/16/2015 06:21  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 16, 2015</time> by SaturnianBlue**
This is great, building Atlases is so hard!
